Package ch.lambdaj.function.aggregate

Interface Summary
Aggregator<T> Defines an aggregation operation, i.e. how to aggregate the items of a collection.
 

Class Summary
Chooser<T> An abstract class that define the behaviour af an Aggregator which aggregates two items of a collection just by choosing one of them.
ChooserOnArgument<T,A> An Aggregator that chooses between two item based on the value of an argument operation invoked on them.
Concat An Aggregator that concats String or more generally the String representation of a given Object
InitializedPairAggregator<T> A PairAggregator that is initialized to the value of its idempotent item.
Max<T> A chooser of the maximum value between two comparable
MaxOnArgument<T,A> A chooser of the item having the maximum value on an argument operation invoked on it.
Min<T> A chooser of the minimum value between two comparable
MinOnArgument<T,A> A chooser of the item having the minimum value on an argument operation invoked on it.
PairAggregator<T> An aggregator that uses the definition of how to aggregate a pair of items and of the empty (idempotent respect to this aggregation) item.
ProxyAggregator<T,A> Proxies a list of objects in order to seamlessly aggregate their value by exposing the API of a single object.
Sum An aggregator that sums numbers
SumDouble An aggregator that sums doubles
SumInteger An aggregator that sums ints
SumLong An aggregator that sums longs
